# C# Docs

## C# concepts

- [Nullable reference types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/nullable-references.md): This article provides an overview of nullable reference types. Learn how the feature provides safety against null reference exceptions, for new and existing projects.
- [Nullable reference migrations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/nullable-migration-strategies.md): Learn nullable contexts, how to enable or disable warnings and annotations, and how to diagnose and fix possible null dereferencing issues.
- [Methods](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/methods.md): Overview of methods, method parameters, and method return values
- [Iterators](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/iterators.md): Learn how to use built-in C# iterators and how to create your own custom iterator methods.
- [Versioning](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/versioning.md): Understand how versioning works in C# and .NET

## Delegates & events

- [Introduction to delegates](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/delegates-overview.md): The first in a series of articles about C# delegates and events. This article introduces basic concepts and discusses language design goals for delegates.
- [System.Delegate and the delegate keyword](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/delegate-class.md): Learn about the classes in .NET that support delegates and how those map to the 'delegate' keyword.
- [Strongly typed delegates](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/delegates-strongly-typed.md): Learn how to use generic delegate types to declare custom types when creating a feature requiring delegates.
- [Common patterns for delegates](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/delegates-patterns.md): Learn about common patterns for using delegates in your code to avoid strong coupling between your components.
- [Introduction to events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/events-overview.md): Learn about events in .NET and our language design goals for events in this overview.
- [Standard .NET event patterns](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/event-pattern.md): Learn about .NET event patterns and how to create standard event sources and subscribe and process standard events in your code.
- [The updated .NET event pattern](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/modern-events.md): Learn how the .NET Core event pattern enables flexibility with backwards compatibility and how to implement safe event processing with async subscribers.
- [Distinguish delegates and events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/distinguish-delegates-events.md): Learn the difference between delegates and events and when to use each of these features of .NET Core.
